node.title: Fish and chip shop owners feeling the pinch amid skyrocketing oil price
node.alt: A pile of chips on some wrapping paper in a fish and chip shop
node.description: Fish and chips are a fast food favourite, but some outlets are finding it tough to make a profit. Here's why the dish is becoming more expensive — for suppliers and consumers.
node.content:
["The cost of fish and chips is tipped to rise because the price of a prominent cooking oil used to fry the family favourite has skyrocketed.", "Strong international demand for canola oil and tight global production has seen Australian canola prices reach historic highs this season.", "While Australian farmers are enjoying the golden opportunity, the food service industry says the rising cost of the key ingredient is making it tough for some fast-food outlets to make a profit.", "
'We're just getting by'
", "Michael Cristaldi runs a small fish and chip shop at Donnybrook in Western Australia's south-west.", "", "
Michael Cristaldi says he's chosen to wear the cost increases because many of his customers are pensioners and families.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Jessica Hayes)
", "He said his canola oil bill had gone up 70 per cent in just a few months \u2014 a cost he has\u00a0had to wear so far in an already challenging market environment.", "\"It's not easy;\u00a0we're just getting by,\" he said.", "But it is\u00a0not just the cost of frying oil that is\u00a0impacting Mr Cristaldi, the frozen chips he buys to serve to his customers are also becoming more expensive.", "", "
Fish and chips are becoming increasingly expensive to produce.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Jessica Hayes)
", "
Margins already thin
", "Bendotti Exporters owns WA Chips\u00a0which is\u00a0the state's only commercial chip manufacturer.", "The business uses about 300,000 litres of canola oil to process about 13,000 tonnes of potatoes into chips annually.", "Non-executive chairman Brian Piesse said canola oil was a major component of the oil blend used in the chip-making process because of its quality.\u00a0", "\"People who have studied the types of oil we should be using believe high-grade canola oil produces the best product at the end of the day,\" he said.", "", "
Brian Piesse says canola oil is a major input cost\u00a0and price increases will have to be passed on.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Jessica Hayes)
", "Mr Piesse said with margins already thin amid high labour, energy transport costs, the business would have to pass on the increased cost of oil in the wholesale chip price.", "\"It's adding significant cost to the process, and how does the manufacturer and the retailer recover that cost?\u00a0The only way to do that is to pass some, or all of that, on to the customer,\" he said.", "
A golden time for farmers\u00a0
", "Thomas Elder Markets analyst Andrew Whitelaw said the canola price had been driven up by drought conditions and logistics challenges in Canada, which is traditionally the world's largest producer.", "\"Canada supplies about 60 per cent of the global trade in canola seed which gets produced into canola oil [but]\u00a0they're no longer really in the market,\" he said.", "\"In recent times their main port has closed down because of storms.", "", "
Australian farmers are enjoying record canola prices in a record production year.\u00a0(ABC News: Chris Lewis)
", "\"So really we've had a situation where the world has gotten pretty short on canola and Australia is going to be the biggest exporter this year.\"", "Mr Whitelaw said while the situation had benefited Australian farmers who were enjoying record canola prices and production, it was having a significant\u00a0impact further along the supply chain.", "\"Across the country the majority of grain growing zones are at over $900 per tonne, they have hit over $1000 per tonne in recent months, especially in the West,\" he said.", "\"Our customers down the line also have to pay the cost.", "\"Whether that's the crush plant that's buying that canola, or whether it's the mum and dad fish and chip in Scarborough or Bunbury where they have to buy oil at an inflated price.\"", "", "
Canola oil is a key ingredient in manufacturing a frying fish and chips.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Jessica Hayes)
", "
Not just canola oil
", "Mr Whitelaw said canola oil operated as a subset of various other oils,\u00a0including palm and soybean, which had also increased in price.", "He said demand for these oils had increased across the board.", "Mr Whitelaw said the price of beef tallow, another favoured cooking fat\u00a0had also increased, adding to profit pressures for the food service industry.", "
Fears for family businesses
", "Michael Xydas owns a wholesale fish and chip distribution business at Wangara in Perth's north.", "He supplies more than 300 clients in the metropolitan area and said the price pressures could be devastating.", "", "
Michael Xydas says the future is uncertain for some small family-run outlets.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Jessica Hayes)
", "\"They [fish and chip shop owners] are small,\u00a0family businesses and when they have to pay so much for oil there's not much profit left,\" he said.", "\"I think the future is very uncertain.\""]
